26 #ifndef REACTPHYSICS3D_MATERIAL_H
27 #define REACTPHYSICS3D_MATERIAL_H
28 
29 // Libraries
30 #include <cassert>
31 #include "configuration.h"
32 
33 namespace reactphysics3d {
34 
35 // Class Material
41 class Material {
42 
43  private :
44 
45  // -------------------- Attributes -------------------- //
46 
48  decimal mFrictionCoefficient;
49 
51  decimal mRollingResistance;
52 
54  decimal mBounciness;
55 
56  public :
57 
58  // -------------------- Methods -------------------- //
59 
61  Material(const WorldSettings& worldSettings);
62 
64  Material(const Material& material);
65 
67  ~Material() = default;
68 
70  decimal getBounciness() const;
71 
73  void setBounciness(decimal bounciness);
74 
76  decimal getFrictionCoefficient() const;
77 
79  void setFrictionCoefficient(decimal frictionCoefficient);
80 
82  decimal getRollingResistance() const;
83 
85  void setRollingResistance(decimal rollingResistance);
86 
88  std::string to_string() const;
89 
91  Material& operator=(const Material& material);
92 };
93 
94 // Return the bounciness
98 inline decimal Material::getBounciness() const {
99  return mBounciness;
100 }
101 
102 // Set the bounciness.
105 
108 inline void Material::setBounciness(decimal bounciness) {
109  assert(bounciness >= decimal(0.0) && bounciness <= decimal(1.0));
110  mBounciness = bounciness;
111 }
112 
113 // Return the friction coefficient
117 inline decimal Material::getFrictionCoefficient() const {
118  return mFrictionCoefficient;
119 }
120 
121 // Set the friction coefficient.
124 
127 inline void Material::setFrictionCoefficient(decimal frictionCoefficient) {
128  assert(frictionCoefficient >= decimal(0.0));
129  mFrictionCoefficient = frictionCoefficient;
130 }
131 
132 // Return the rolling resistance factor. If this value is larger than zero,
133 // it will be used to slow down the body when it is rolling
134 // against another body.
138 inline decimal Material::getRollingResistance() const {
139  return mRollingResistance;
140 }
141 
142 // Set the rolling resistance factor. If this value is larger than zero,
143 // it will be used to slow down the body when it is rolling
144 // against another body.
148 inline void Material::setRollingResistance(decimal rollingResistance) {
149  assert(rollingResistance >= 0);
150  mRollingResistance = rollingResistance;
151 }
152 
153 // Return a string representation for the material
154 inline std::string Material::to_string() const {
155 
156  std::stringstream ss;
157 
158  ss << "frictionCoefficient=" << mFrictionCoefficient << std::endl;
159  ss << "rollingResistance=" << mRollingResistance << std::endl;
160  ss << "bounciness=" << mBounciness << std::endl;
161 
162  return ss.str();
163 }
164 
165 // Overloaded assignment operator
166 inline Material& Material::operator=(const Material& material) {
167 
168  // Check for self-assignment
169  if (this != &material) {
170  mFrictionCoefficient = material.mFrictionCoefficient;
171  mBounciness = material.mBounciness;
172  mRollingResistance = material.mRollingResistance;
173  }
174 
175  // Return this material
176  return *this;
177 }
178 
179 }
180 
181 #endif
